resisting damage during flood conditions in accordance with subsection 45415 of this chapter 6 the agricultural structure must comply with the floodway encroachment provisions of subsection 45425 of this chapter 7 major equipment machinery or other contents must be protected such protection may include protective watertight floodproofed areas within the building the use of equipment hoists for readily elevating contents permanently elevating contents on pedestals or shelves above the base flood elevation or determining that property owners can safely remove contents without risk to lives and that the contents will be located to a specified site out of the floodplain  1exh a 5142018 considerations in passing upon such applications the appeal board shall consider all technical evaluations all relevant factors all standards specified in other sections of this chapter and 1 the danger that materials may be swept onto other lands to the injury of others  2 the danger to life and property due to flooding or erosion damage and the safety of access to the property in times of flood for ordinary and emergency vehicles  3 the susceptibility of the proposed facility and its contents to flood damage and the effect of such damage on the individual owner  4 the importance of the services provided by the proposed facility to the community  5 the necessity to the facility of a waterfront location where applicable  6 the availability of alternative locations not subject to flooding or erosion damage for the proposed use  7 the compatibility of the proposed use with existing and anticipated development and the relationship of the proposed use to the comprehensive plan and floodplain management program for that area  8 the expected heights velocity duration rate of rise and sediment transport of the floodwaters and the effects of wave action if applicable expected at the site  9 the costs of providing governmental services during and after flood conditions including maintenance and repair of public utilities and facilities such as sewer gas electrical and water systems and streets and bridges  and 10 agricultural structures must be located in wide expansive floodplain areas where no other alternative location for the agricultural structure exists the applicant must demonstrate that the entire farm acreage consisting of a contiguous parcel of land on which the structure is to be located must be in the special flood hazard area and no other alternative locations for the structure are available  1exh a 5142018 findings findings listed above shall be submitted to the appeal board in writing and included in the application for a variance additionally comments from the department of natural resources land water and conservation division state coordinators office must be taken into account and included in the permit file  1exh a 5142018 floodways variances shall not be issued within any designated floodway if any increase in flood levels during the base flood discharge would result unless a clomr is obtained prior to issuance of the variance in order to ensure the project is built in compliance with the clomr for which the variance is granted the applicant must provide a bond for 100 percent of the cost to perform the development  1exh a 5142018 conditions upon consideration of the factors listed above and the purposes of this chapter the appeal board may attach such conditions to the granting of variances as it deems necessary to further the purposes of this chapter the following conditions shall apply to all variances 1 variances may not be issued when the variance will make the structure in violation of other federal state or local laws regulations or ordinances 2 variances shall only be issued upon a determination that the variance is the minimum necessary considering the flood hazard to afford relief 3 variances shall only be issued upon a showing of good and sufficient cause a determination that failure to grant the variance would result in exceptional hardship and a determination that the granting of a variance will not result in increased flood heights additional threats to public safety extraordinary public expense create nuisance cause fraud on or victimization of the public or conflict with existing local laws or ordinances 4 any applicant to whom a variance is granted shall be given written notice specifying the difference between the base flood elevation bfe and the elevation to which the structure is to be built and a written statement that the cost of flood insurance will be commensurate with the increased risk such notification shall be maintained with a record of all variance actions 5 the local floodplain administrator shall maintain the records of all appeal actions and report any variances to the federal emergency management agency fema upon request 6 variances shall not be issued for unpermitted development or other development that is not in compliance with the provisions of this chapter violations must be corrected in accordance with subsection 4535e of this chapter  1exh a 5142018 reserved article vi  legal status provisions effect on rights and in the city shall be maintained in a state of good repair at all times  inspection a the department of public safety is hereby charged with the duty of making such periodic inspection of all taxicabs architecture of aiken 2 the local government 3 the proper conduct of tour guides 4 the regulations applicable to the conduct of tours within the city b the fee for the initial and subsequent tour upon payment of the applicable fee for each examination f successful passage of the tour guide certification examination shall be upon a grade of 80 percent or greater upon each successful passage a certified tour card shall be issued for a period of three years during which time the applicant shall not be required to take the examination again g at the expiration of the threeyear period the examination again before being issued a new tour guide certification for another threeyear period h all examination papers shall be fairly and impartially graded and shall be retained by the tour coordinator until the appeal period provided hereinafter has expired i a tour guide certification shall be in effect for 36 months from the date of issue certification may be renewed upon application and payment of the required fee for each 36month period thereafter unless the permit for the proceeding period has been revoked or is suspended j a tour guide certification card issued under this article is not transferable and is to be used solely by the person to whom it was issued k it shall be unlawful to alter deface obliterate or destroy a tour guide verification identification card or carriage operated on the streets of the city shall be maintained in a safe mechanical condition with all safety equipment remaining intact and operative at all times when the carriage is in service b each carriage shall be maintained all metal should be clean each carriage will be kept in a clean and sanitary condition free of litter and debris at all times suitable for public transportation of passengers d harness used shall be clean and in good condition bitless bridles are forbidden exh a 11132006 safety equipment the following safety equipment shall be maintained on each carriage at all times 1 a first aid kit 2 a twoway radio or mobile telephone for immediate communication with the companys home office 3 a halter and lead shank for each animal hitched to the carriage exh a 11132006 traffic related regulations the operator of any animaldrawn vehicle within the city shall be subject to vehicle and traffic provisions of this ordinance and shall operate his or her carriage in accordance with the traffic laws of the state 1 no driver shall permit an animal to pull a carriage at a speed faster than a slow trot except for emergency situations in such emergencies the driver shall take all precautionary measures possible so not to endanger any passenger or other person 2 due to the nature of operating animaldrawn vehicles in areas of congestion and heavy traffic within the city it shall be unlawful to operate an animaldrawn vehicle except when the animals are under complete control and with due care for the safety of others due caution should be exercised when emergency vehicles are present and using emergency warning lights or sirens 3 whenever three or more motor vehicles are backed up behind a horsedrawn carriage the driver shall at the earliest reasonable opportunity pull the carriage over to the side of the road to allow those vehicles to pass 4 all carriages for hire must keep moving at all times and may not stop except as required by traffic regulations and by subsection b above and where particular exigencies reasonably require it 5 in the case of an accident or breakdown the vehicle should be moved if possible so as to not impede traffic 6 any driver who experiences a mechanical failure of the carriage or harness while on the roads will move the passengers to safety and then unhitch the horse from the vehicle exh a 11132006 general operating regulations a the total number of horsedrawn carriages allowed to operate at any one time upon the streets of the city is limited to six of which four may be on tour any carriages in excess of the four on tour shall only be permitted if the carriage is in transport to or from their staging area the carriages in operation shall be divided equally among the carriage companies b in order to relieve congestion on the streets and to mitigate impact upon residents and businesses no more than one carriage shall be driven along any threeblock section in the same direction at any one time a threeblock section is defined as that linear segment of any individual street circumscribed by four contiguous intersecting streets where these spacing requirements are not met the drivers of the last carriages to enter that section shall generally be deemed to have committed the violation this provision applies only to carriages while used for hire however drivers of carriages which are not being used for hire are encouraged to observe these spacing requirements c carriage company shall be responsible for maintaining the cleanliness of the loading zone d no driver shall collect fares make change or take on or discharge passengers when the carriage is in motion e it shall be unlawful for a driver of any carriage to leave the vehicle or the immediate premises there of while the vehicle is parked or while awaiting passengers f it shall be unlawful for any person to solicit passengers verbally or by gesture directly or indirectly or to advertise or hawk tickets at any loading zone upon the streets or in any public outdoor space of the city the sale of tour tickets may only occur inside on private property or other locations as designated by city council g it shall be unlawful to consume or transport alcoholic beverages aboard any carriage while touring h a driver may refuse service to any potential customer who appears to be impaired or disorderly i any driver or operator discovering personal property left on his carriage shall deliver or report such property to the office of the carriage company within 12 hours after the discovery the drivers report shall include brief particulars to enable the company to identify the owner of the lost property the driver will advise any passenger claiming to have lost property while on tours to report such loss to the police the company shall retain any found property for at least 60 days before disposal j carriages shall not be operated in adverse weather conditions k drivers must keep the horses reins in their hands while an animal is hitched to the carriage only the driver may handle the reins whip and brake exh a 11132006 loading zones a passengers may be loaded or discharged only in designated loading zones carriages may remain in loading zone only while loading or discharging passengers or while waiting to load passengers for a prearranged tour however  no carriage may remain in a loading zone for more than ten minutes without providing water to the horse b the following locations are designated as loading zones 1 in front of the washington center for the performing arts located at 126 newberry street 2 location on private property ie outside of the road rightofway and any public areas for prearranged tours or special events 3 location on street adjacent to homes restaurants hotels churches and other establishments for prearranged tours or special events for persons departing from or arriving at those establishments provided that there is no offstreet parking otherwise available and that the carriage is parked outside of any travel lane 4 the city may establish additional loading zones and conditions for those loading zones exh a 11132006 hours of exh a 11132006 stables exercise and paddock area a when stables or exercise lots are maintained within the city limits the company shall maintain the structure and premises in a sanitary condition proper use of lime and pesticides and comply with the following conditions 1 manure shall be cleaned from the stable exercise and paddock area daily and then placed in covered containers or a dempsey dumpster such containers shall be at least 50 feet from any other dwelling or pool patio or other structure on an adjoining lot and at least 25 feet from any property line notwithstanding any other provision contained in this chapter having requirements for covered containers 2 all manure shall be removed from the premises at least weekly or more often as necessary to prevent or reduce the propagation of flies and creation of odors 3 exercise and paddock areas shall be designed and maintained to drain so as to prevent ponding and propagation of insects the area shall be designed and maintained so as to prevent the pollution by drainage or run off into adjacent streams or other water bodies 4 any spilled feed on the property shall be promptly removed so as to prevent attraction of flies rodents and birds or the creation of odors 5 provisions shall also be made for insect control 6 the exercise or training areas on the property shall be dampened to prevent dust b horses will be provided the following conditions 1 each individual animal shall have a stall large enough for the animal to safely turn around  but no individual animal may be kept in a stall less than ten feet by 12 feet or 120 square feet in area except that standing stalls may be used for less than 12 hours per day ceilings in stalls and stables shall be at least nine feet from the bedding and flooring 2 ventilation adequate to ensure good health and comfort of animals shall be provided in stable and stall areas 3 adequate and leakfree roofing is required for any stable or stall area in which animals are housed in the city 4 adequate amounts of straw bedding or shavings in stalls shall be kept clean and dry 5 adequate fresh water shall be provided in paddocks and stalls at all times while any animal is present 6 food shall be kept free of contamination and stored in rodentproof containers c complaints regarding any stable or lot that is not maintained in compliance with the foregoing requirements should be filed with the city of aiken animal control officer exh a 11132006 treatment and condition of horses a a licensed veterinarian shall certify after due and proper inspection the good health of each animal before it is placed in service a minimum of one such health inspections and certificates shall be required for each animal each calendar year b no driver may use more than a light touch of the whip upon any animal and no driver or other person may forcefully strike an animal or make movements or noise intended to frighten or harm an animal c horses shall be allowed access to fresh water at least every one hour while in service d horses shall not be in harness more than two and onehalf hours consecutively without at least 30 minutes of rest e no animal shall be subject to any condition or treatment whether in service or out of service which will impair the good health and physical condition of that animal this includes providing shade as relief from heat when not working f unless written approval is given by a licensed veterinarian no animal having open sores or wounds or any disease or ailment shall be permitted to be in service on the streets of the city g prompt veterinary care and services shall be provided for sick horses and when deemed necessary by a licensed veterinarian the sick horse shall be promptly removed from the immediate service h each animal shall have its hooves properly trimmed and shod for street use i each animal shall be groomed daily in order that there are no signs of fungus dandruff or a dirty coat i harnesses shall be properly fitted maintained and clean so that no irritating material will come in direct contact with the animal j horse shall not be worked in extreme conditions of heat and humidity which may be harmful to the horse k carriage animals shall be a minimum of 1000 lbs no one horse may be used to pull more than one and onehalf times its own weight exh a 11132006 inspections compliance and as a condition of holding a license under the provisions of this chapter shall establish and maintain a fixed headquarters on public or private property for the operation of the companys business the headquarters shall conform to all applicable city ordinances c applicants shall provide their most recent tax return income verification profitloss statements or other verification of gross receipts as part of their business license application d applicants shall also provide a record of conviction by any criminal court if any of any tour guides the applicant or if the applicant is a corporation the criminal court record of the officers directors and supervising employees thereof and all operators applicants will obtain these criminal record reports from the aiken department of public safety e any applicant who fails to comply with the requirements of this chapter shall not be issued a business license until proof of compliance is presented by the applicant and certified by the city tour supervisor public safety department or codes enforcement officer all of the requirements of this chapter both serve as conditions for issuance of a license and apply to the business once operational f the business license administrator or other designated official may temporarily suspend the business license of any walking tour company for violation of any provision of this ordinance the walking tour company may appeal any such suspension to city council provided a written appeal has been submitted to the business license administrator within ten days of the suspension decision g no more than two separate walking tour companies shall be licensed to operate in the city h the business license administrator tourism director or other designated official shall determine whether a company that applies for a walking tour operators license is indeed a different company with separate ownership management and equipment existing walking tour companies shall not be given a license to operate for a new company created in name only exh a 182007 general operating regulations a the guide and guests of a walking tour shall not trespass on private property block streets or deny access to driveways the tour company shall be responsible for collection and removal of all trash generated by guests b it shall be unlawful to consume or transport alcoholic beverages while participating in any walking tour c a guide may refuse tour service to any potential customer who appears to be uncooperative boisterous impaired disorderly or in any manner disruptive to conducting a tour d walking tours shall not be operated in adverse weather conditions as determined by the tourism supervisor e speaker phones bullhorns or other audio amplification devices are prohibited on walking tours f walking tour routes must be approved by the city manager or another person designated by the city manager g no animals shall be permitted on tours except service animals or animals trained to assist the visually impaired h any person conducting a walking tour must be certified by the city of aiken tourism supervisor as a tour guide exh a 182007 hours of operation number of guests and frequency of tours walking tours for hire shall be operated on the streets of the city only as follows 1 tours are permitted between  am to  pm in the downtown commercial districts 2 tours are permitted between  am and  pm in residential areas however tours using routes which focus on city commercial areas which utilize residential streets may operate until  pm 3 in the horse district hd zone residential single family stable rss zone and on colleton avenue walking tours must begin after  am and terminate before  pm 4 no more than four walking tours per month may be conducted outside the downtown commercial area except on a tour route which is specifically approved for use after  pm 5 prior to  pm walking tours in the downtown commercial area are limited to 28 guests 6 after  pm tours in the downtown commercial area are permitted up to 40 guests tour groups numbering between 28 and 40 guests must have an additional person assisting with the tour tour assistants will not require such certification but must be recognized designees of the tour company 7 any walking tour outside the downtown commercial area except on those routes approved for use after  pm are limited to 15 guests after  pm up to 40 guests are allowed on specifically approved routes 8 no more than two walking tours may be conducted at any one time and tours must be spaced at least two blocks apart except at the tour departure or completion area exh a 182007 tour guide certification it shall be unlawful for persons to act or offer to act as tour guides for hire within the city limits unless they have been certified by the city exh a 182007 special events the city manager or a city manager designee may approve exceptions to this chapter regarding routes maximum number of guests and hours for special events exh a 182007 enforcement a the city manager shall designate the appropriate agency within city government to enforce the provisions of this chapter violations of this chapter are unlawful and shall carry a fine of not less than $10000 and not more than $50000 per occurrence other punishment within the jurisdiction of the municipal court may also be exacted from violators tour operators may contest any citation in municipal court b a walking tour company upon continued violation of the provisions of this article by the company its agents employees or persons acting on its behalf then its right to operate a walking tour shall be administratively suspended as follows 1 upon two violations within a threemonth period the company shall be suspended for a period not to exceed seven days 2 upon three violations within a oneyear period the company shall be suspended for a period not to exceed 30 days 3 upon four violations within a oneyear period the company shall be suspended for a period not to exceed 180 days 4 once a 180day suspension period has been served if the company continues to violate the ordinance and receives three violations within the oneyear period following the 180day suspension all permits and certifications will be permanently revoked exh a 182007 notforhire tours a individuals conducting tours to special groups for no cost may do so in accordance to the provisions set forth in section 46253 general operating regulations section 46254 hours of operation and frequency section 46255 tour guide certification section 46256 special events and section 46257 enforcement b donations for nonprofit organizations may be accepted in lieu of tour fees c notforhire tours whether accepting donations or not shall adhere to section 46259 tour reports as described below exh a 182007 tour reports a each operator shall on the date or within the time period hereinafter prescribed make a report to the tourism supervisor on forms provided the total number of tours conducted and the total number of guests for each tour conducted required reports shall be remitted to the tourism supervisor on or before the fifteenth day of the following month after the quarter the quarters are defined as january to march april to june july to september and october to december if the due date for reporting falls on a saturday or sunday or a federal state or city of aiken observed holiday then reporting is considered timely on the following business day furthermore if the due date for reporting falls during the period of a natural disaster which directly precluded the responsible party from timely submitting the reports and payments an additional tenday extension may be granted upon written request to the tourism supervisor a natural disaster is defined as a hurricane earthquake flood tornado or winter weather that prevents normal business from being conducted the responsible party is considered directly precluded from timely submitting reports if their offices are deemed by emergency officials to be damaged to the extent of being unsafe or unavailable for use due to the disaster or postal service to the immediate area is suspended during the due date b failure to file the required reports under this section will subject the operator to a $5000 civil penalty notwithstanding the foregoing any misrepresentation of the information required by returns as set forth in subsection a hereof shall subject the tour operator to suspension andor revocation of his business license by the business license administrator andor the tour guide certificate as may be determined by the director of parks recreation and tourism or the directors designee the tour operator may appeal any such suspension or revocation to the city manager or the city managers designee provided a written appeal has been submitted to the business license administrator within ten days of the decision to suspend or revoke exh a 182007 article vi  towing franchises nonexclusive franchisecity council authority to grant the city council may and is empowered to grant to any qualified person a nonexclusive franchise to engage in the business of providing conventional towing services and heavy duty towing services in response to requests by the department of public safety heavy duty towing services are defined as services with wreckers capable of towing motor vehicles weighing over 7000 pounds exh a 592011 minimum eligibility for towing franchise aiken department of public safety shall investigate the facts listed in the application for a nonexclusive towing franchise within 60 days after completion of the investigation the application shall be reviewed by city council unless any one of the following exists 1 the applicant has been removed from the franchise list within the last 24 months  2 a material statement made in the application is untrue  3 a fact exists of which the director of public safety or his designee has knowledge of which would be cause for removal or suspension of the applicant from the rotation list  4 the applicant has not been issued a city business license  5 the applicant has a felony conviction  6 the applicant has not obtained the required insurance exh a 592011 right of owner or driver to request a towing service the owner or driver of a wrecked or disabled vehicle shall have the right to choose any towing service even if such service has not been granted a city franchise before calling any towing service to tow a wrecked or disabled vehicle the investigating officer on the scene should if practical determine the wrecked or disabled vehicle owners or drivers preference for towing services exh a 592011 rules and regulations for conventional towing services all towing services granted a nonexclusive conventional towing franchise must comply with the following 1 all towing services shall maintain a secure storage area for all vehicles towed this may be a locked building or a secured fencedin area where the stored vehicles and other property shall not be accessible to the public each service will have personnel available during normal business hours for the public to have access to their vehicle if needed 2 each towing service shall provide the department of public safety with normal working hours business day and night phone numbers holiday phone numbers pager numbers and cellular phone numbers as available 3 all towing services shall be equipped with and utilize legally authorized lighting and other safety equipment to protect the motoring public this equipment shall be maintained in good working order 4 the following equipment must be carried on all wreckers brooms shovels a container to haul glass and other debris from the highway a fivepoundabcrated fire extinguisher absorbent material and safety chains and tiedown chains for haulers rollback the towing service shall clean the roadway prior to leaving a wreck scene 5 towing services shall be available to the department of public safety 24 hours each day seven days per week and 52 weeks per year each towing service shall keep its facilities adequately staffed during all service hours each towing service shall respond to a request for the release of a motor vehicle from its service facility the following business day or on an agreed upon time of release that is within reason for both parties 6 towing services shall not respond to a scene for service unless requested by a proper public safety authority 7 motor vehicles that have been reported stolen or which have been designated as evidence shall be towed to a location to be determined by the officer on the scene once a stolen vehicle is approved by the department of public safety for release the vehicle owner or the owners designee must show proof that the towing charge has been paid and then the owners vehicle will be returned 8 all other motor vehicles must be towed to the services facility and secured there until claimed by the owner or other person entitled to lawful possession of the motor vehicle or if unclaimed until lawful disposal of the motor vehicle has been effected by the towing service in accordance with state law 9 towing services must be available to respond within 30 minutes to any scene where an officer will be standing by awaiting that response in the event that 30 minutes expires without wrecker arrival the officer may request the onduty dispatcher to confirm the expiration of time attempt to contact the tardy towing service to advise of the cancellation and summon the next towing service on the appropriate list in the event that the tardy towing service arrives after cancellation and summoning of another towing service the tardy towing service will be turned away repeated failures to respond to any scene within 30 minutes may result in removal from the rotation list 10 the towing service must have a wrecker of sufficient size and strength to handle a job a separate rotation list shall be maintained for the heavyduty wreckers where services of a heavyduty wrecker are needed a heavyduty wrecker shall be called from the heavyduty wrecker list 11 charges for work performed and storage fees must be in compliance with the current version of the south carolina highway patrol wrecker rotation fee schedule which is published by the south carolina department of public safety 12 wrecker operators must conduct themselves in a proper manner at all collision scenes and when dealing with the public 13 towing services and operators shall be familiar and comply with the laws regarding business solicitations on south carolina highways 14 each towing service on the city franchise rotation list must have signs on its vehicle doors indicating the companys name address and telephone number the signs must be plainly visible with letters not less than two inches high in a color which contrasts to that of the wrecker 15 each wrecker on the vehicle rotation list shall be equipped with a towing log the log shall be maintained by the towing service and shall accurately reflect all towing done by the towing service at the request of the aiken department of public safety the towing log format should be the same design as now required by the south carolina highway patrol each towing service owner shall be responsible for producing this towing log to the city upon request 16 all towing services on the city franchise rotation list shall carry liability insurance on its wreckers and its premises in an aggregate amount not less than $75000000 17 all towing services on the franchise lists shall carry garage keepers liability insurance covering customers vehicles in a prorata amount calculated upon the basis of the square footage of vehicle storage space for that business on a formula approved by the city manager in no event shall this garage keepers insurance be in an aggregate amount of less than $5000000 18 towing services shall be responsible for securing personal property in a vehicle at a towing scene to the best of their ability in no event however shall a towing service be responsible for personal items that do not come into the possession of the towing service 19 the towing service shall be available to release within a reasonable period of time all essential personal property in any towed vehicle to the rightful owner on a 24hour per day sevenday per week basis the towing service location shall have an agent present during normal business hours and at the request of any rightful owner of any towed vehicle or owners designee the towing service must immediately release all essential personal items including but not limited to medicines medical equipment keys clothing tools of their trade child restraint systems and perishable items 20 the towing service shall upon receipt of proof of ownership or right of possession and the payment of service fees for the motor vehicle release the motor vehicle to its owner or other person entitled to its lawful possession towing services shall effect the release of motor vehicles during all service hours and shall provide the person taking possession of the motor vehicle an itemized invoice specifying all service fees paid and record and maintain for the term of the franchise plus three years the following information for each motor vehicle released a date and time of release b motor vehicle year make model body style and vin c license plate number and state d name address drivers license number and state  and the residence and business telephone number for the person taking motor vehicle possession 21 any complaints from a towing service regarding any incidents involving a public safety officer or the departments operation of the wrecker list must be received by the director of public safety within 15 days of the alleged incident 22 failure of any towing service to comply with these regulations may result in their removal from the rotation list violation of any of these provisions is hereby declared unlawful exh a 592011   1 3112019 rules and regulations for heavy duty towing services all towing services exh a 592011   1 3112019 public safety administration of franchise towing services a the wrecker rotation list shall be administered fairly and in a manner designed to ensure that all towing services on the list have an opportunity to provide involuntary towing service business arising from the rotation list standard procedure for selecting the next eligible wrecker on the city towing service rotation list will be made by proceeding to call the next service on the list b towing services shall be called from the rotation lists as set forth above if a particular towing service is unavailable when called it shall be passed over and the next wrecker on the appropriate list shall be called to the scene however if a towing service or wrecker driver is unable to answer the call the dispatcher shall be notified about the reason for that towing services unavailability and log it in the towing log book repeated failures by a towing service to respond to calls for service may result in removal from the rotation list c if an officer must cancel a wrecker it will be done as soon as possible if possible the wrecker will be cancelled by the communications center prior to its arrival however if the wrecker must be cancelled at the scene the officer shall inform the dispatcher to place the towing service back on the top of the appropriate rotation list d aiken department of public safety staff and officers are prohibited from owning any financial interest or any form of ownership interest in any towing service granted a franchise under this chapter e aiken department of public safety staff and officers are prohibited from recommending services from a particular towing service f except in cases such as wrecked or disabled motor vehicles where the request for towing is made by a public safety officer at the direct request of the owner or driver of the vehicle a tow report shall be completed for all motor vehicles for which services are provided upon completion of the tow report by the official it shall be reviewed for accuracy and signed by the official and towing service representative at the scene motor vehicles shall not be moved from the scene until the tow report has been completed and its removal authorized by the official tow reports must set forth at least the following minimum information 1 status abandonedderelictconfiscatedstolenevidencenuisance 2 year make model and body style of motor vehicle 3 vehicle identification number vin 4 license plate number and state 5 detailed description of the physical condition of the motor vehicle to include any damage missing parts or accessories and such other information as will accurately describe the motor vehicles condition at the time of the tow 6 itemized list of all personal property contained in the motor vehicle as well as any personal property removed by the towing service or official for preservation and safekeeping 7 name and address of last registered owner of vehicle 8 name and address of all known registered lienholders 9 name badge number and signature of requesting officer 10 towing service information g except in cases such as wrecked or disabled motor vehicles where the request for towing is made by a public safety officer at the direct request of the owner or driver of the vehicle a towing report is not required in these cases the towing service may obtain owner and lienholder information by making a written request to the aiken department of public safety exh a 592011 suspension from franchise list any towing service granted a nonexclusive franchise may be suspended by the director of public safety or his designee from such list if the towing service fails to comply with any of the conditions regulations or requirements of this chapter upon learning of grounds for suspension the director of public safety or his designee shall immediately by written notice inform the owner of the towing service of his action of suspension the director of public safety or his designee may reinstate the towing service to the rotation list upon satisfactory proof that the towing service is in compliance with the conditions regulations and requirements of this chapter exh a 592011 removal from franchise list a any towing service placed on the rotation list may be removed from such list for one or more of the following grounds 1 the towing service has been suspended from the rotation list at least once and repeatedly or intentionally fails to comply with any of the conditions regulations or requirements of this chapter 2 the towing service fails to perform the duties established by this chapter or the towing franchise agreement by any of the following fails to timely answer calls fails to respond to calls within a reasonable time fails to maintain clean and orderly storage facilities or at any time fails to clean the roadway of glass and debris at an accident scene 3 the owner of the towing service sells 51 percent or more of the business provided the person or persons purchasing the business may apply for placement on the rotation list 4 the owner of a towing service applies for placement on the rotation list under another name 5 when any fact exists that would constitute a ground for denial of an application pursuant to this chapter or the towing franchise agreement b the director of public safety or his designee upon learning of grounds for removal shall immediately by written notice inform the owner of the towing service of his action of removal and the grounds for removal within ten days after receipt of the written notice the owner shall have the right to file a written request for a hearing before the director of public safety or his designee if the owner files a timely hearing request the director of public safety or his designee shall set a time and place for the hearing all parties involved shall have the right to offer testimony documents and tangible evidence at a hearing on the issues and to be represented by counsel exh a 592011 appeal a within five business days after receiving written notification that any applicant has been removed from the rotation list the applicant shall have the right to appeal such order by filing a written notice of appeal including a written statement stating the grounds of the appeal with the city clerk the written statement shall include but not be limited to statements why the applicant believes the decision of the director of public safety should be reconsidered upon the filing of the notice of appeal and written statement the city clerk shall set a time date and place for a public hearing on the matter and shall notify the applicant of the hearing the hearing shall be heard at a regular meeting of the council not later than 30 days after the written notice and statement was filed with the city clerk b such appeal shall be heard by the city council which may affirm amend or reverse the decision or take other action deemed appropriate subject to the limitations of the terms and conditions of the towing franchise agreement c in conducting the hearing the city council shall not be limited to the technical rules of evidence under the south carolina rules of evidence d if no appeal is filed within the time prescribed the action of the director of public safety or his designee shall be final notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter in the event that any appeal is filed the appellant shall not be allowed to participate in any tows or be placed on the tow rotation list until such time as the appellant is approved or reinstated exh a 592011 zoning ordinance city of aiken south carolina adopted  revised june 2009 republished may 2014 current officials of the city of aiken south carolina 2014 ____________ fred june 200 and ordinances subsequently adopted by the city council the source of each section is included in the history note appearing in parentheses at the end thereof the absence of such a note indicates that the section is new and was adopted for the first time with the adoption of the use of the comparative tables appearing in the back of this the reader can locate any section of the 1999 as supplemented and any subsequent ordinance included herein system the chapter and section numbering system used in this the same system used in many state and local government codes each section number consists of three parts separated by a decimal the figure before the first decimal refers to the chapter number the figure after the first decimal is the article number the figure after the second decimal refers to the position of the section within the chapter thus the first section of chapter 1 article 2 is numbered  page numbering system the page numbering system used in this a prefix system the letters to the left of the colon are an abbreviation which represents a certain portion of the volume the number to the right of the colon represents the number of the page in that portion in the case of a chapter of the the number to the left of the colon indicates the number of the chapter in the case of an appendix to the the letter immediately to the left of the colon indicates the letter of the appendix the following are typical parts of codes of ordinances which may or may not appear in this this time and their corresponding prefixes zoning code  zoning code comparative tables zct1 zoning code index zi1 index the index has been prepared with the greatest of care each particular item has been placed under several headings some of which are couched in lay phraseology others in legal terminology and still others in language generally used by local government officials and employees there are numerous cross references within the index itself which stand as guideposts to direct the user to the particular item in which the user is interested looseleaf supplements a special feature of this publication is the looseleaf system of binding and supplemental servicing of the publication with this system the publication will be kept uptodate subsequent amendatory legislation will be properly edited and the affected page or pages will be reprinted these new pages will be distributed to holders of copies of the publication with instructions for the manner of inserting the new pages and deleting the obsolete pages keeping this publication uptodate at all times will depend largely upon the holder of the publication as revised pages are received it will then become the responsibility of the holder to have the amendments inserted according to the attached instructions it is strongly recommended by the publisher that all such amendments be inserted immediately upon receipt to avoid misplacing them and in addition that all deleted pages be saved and filed for historical reference purposes acknowledgments this publication was under the direct supervision of dennis sinnett vicepresident of supplementation and kelly heaton and janet cramer editors ordinancegeneral provisions chapter 1  general provisions article 1  general   short title this be known as the zoning  and the map herein referred to which is identified by the title zoning map city of aiken south carolina shall be known as the zoning map   authority this adopted pursuant to the authority granted by of title 6 of the laws of south carolina as amended including the amendments in the south carolina local government comprehensive planning enabling act of 199 except where specific reference is made to authority granted by other provisions of said purpose this intended to ensure that development is compatible with existing and future needs of the community while promoting the public health safety convenience order appearance prosperity and general welfare in accordance with the purposes provided in laws of south carolina specific purposes of this but are not limited to the following 1 provide for adequate light air and open space 2 prevent the overcrowding of land avoid undue concentrations of population and lessen street congestion 3 facilitate creation of a convenient attractive and harmonious community 4 protect and preserve scenic historic or ecologically sensitive areas 5 regulate population density and distribution of population and the uses of buildings structures and land for trade industry residence recreation agriculture forestry conservation airports and approaches thereto water supply sanitation protection against floods public activities and other purposes 6 facilitate economic growth and business development 7 facilitate the adequate provision or availability of transportation police and fire protection water sewage disposal schools parks and other recreational facilities affordable housing disaster evacuation and other public services 8 secure safety from fire flood and other dangers 9 further the public welfare in any other way specified by city council   jurisdiction this the provisions it contains shall govern all development within the incorporated area of the city of aiken as now or may be hereafter established together with such unincorporated areas of aiken county which city council and the aiken county council may jointly agree to become governed by this zoning affects every building structure and use no building structure or premises shall be used and no building structure or part thereof shall be erected moved remodeled extended enlarged or altered except in conformity with this addition no other activity including land clearing or tree removal regulated by this be authorized unless in conformity with this minimum requirements in interpreting and applying provisions of this these provisions shall be held to be the minimum requirements for the promotion of the public safety health convenience comfort prosperity and general welfare   reduction of lot area or increase in density no lot shall be so reduced or subdivided in a way that causes it not to meet the requirements in this minimum lot area and lot width nor shall the density of population be increased in any manner except in conformity with the regulations herein established   conflicting provisions where there is a conflict or apparent conflict between provisions of this the more restrictive provision shall control where it is possible to implement administer or construe a particular provision in more than one way it shall be implemented administered or construed in the way that eliminates or minimizes conflicts with other provisions of this this a more restrictive standard than required by any other city ordinances or requirements the provisions of this govern conversely whenever any city ordinance or requirement imposes a stricter standard than required by this the provisions of such city ordinance or requirement shall govern   relationship to deed restrictions public regulation of land is entirely separate from and independent of private deed restrictions no weight shall be given to the effect of deed restrictions in construing this nor shall this given inappropriate consideration in the construction of deed restrictions where there is a conflict between this any private restrictions the more restrictive provisions shall apply   relationship to comprehensive plan it is intended that this the planning policies adopted as part of the citys comprehensive land use and transportation plan hereafter the comprehensive plan as amended and periodically updated including all supplements and attachments thereto   enactment of interim ordinances the provisions of this be superseded from time to time by the enactment of interim ordinances that affect the timing and issuance of approvals or other standards or provisions of this the period specified by the interim ordinance any provision of this specifically regulated by the interim ordinance shall not be affected   effective date the effective date of this codified updated and amended be    validity if any section subsection sentence clause or phrase of this for any reason held to be unconstitutional such decision shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions of this council hereby declares that it would have passed this zoning districts article 1  general   division of city into districts in order to regulate and restrict the location of uses and buildings designed erected altered moved or occupied for specified purposes  to regulate and limit the height bulk and size of buildings hereafter erected altered or moved  to regulate and limit the density of population and vehicular congestion  and to protect historic landmarks and districts the city of aiken south carolina is hereby divided into zoning districts designated as follows base zoning districts residential districts rs15 residential singlefamily 15000 sq feet  lot rs10 residential singlefamily 10000 sq feet  lot rs8 residential singlefamily 8000 sq feet  lot rs6 residential singlefamily 6000 sq feet  lot rsh residential singlefamilyhorse rss residential singlefamilystable rsa residential singlefamily attached rsm residential manufactured home rml residential multifamily lowdensity rmh residential multifamily highdensity rmp residential manufactured home park special purpose districts pr planned residential hd horse district os open space commercial districts lp limited professional lb limited business o officeinstitutional gb general business pc planned commercial pi planned institutional db downtown business industrial districts li light industrial lm limited manufacturing  i industrial overlay zoning districts  h historic district  oa old aiken overlay district   zoning map the zoning districts referred to above shall be designated by boundaries on the zoning map which is attached hereto and is expressly made a part of this map shall be updated within 60 days following annexation rezoning or other change   rules governing district boundaries a existing boundaries where uncertainty exists as to the boundaries of districts as shown on the zoning map the following rules shall apply 1 boundaries indicated as approximately following the centerline of streets highways or alleys shall be construed to follow such centerlines where a street vacation has occurred boundaries shall follow the revised lot lines approximating the previous centerline of the street 2 boundaries indicated as approximately following platted lot lines shall be construed as following such lot lines no lot shall be divided by such boundary 3 boundaries indicated as approximately following city limits shall be construed as following such city limits 4 boundaries indicated as following railroad lines shall be construed to be midway between the main tracks 5 boundaries indicated as approximately following the center lines of ditches streams rivers or other bodies of water shall be construed to follow such centerlines 6 boundaries indicated as parallel to or extensions of features indicated in paragraphs 1 above shall be so construed distances not specifically indicated on the zoning map shall be determined by the planning director 7 where boundaries cannot be determined using the paragraphs above the planning director shall interpret the district boundaries in accordance with  b new district boundaries any new zoning district boundary created after the effective date of this follow a property line   annexations and other adjustments to city limits where city limits change by virtue of annexation or some other means the following provisions shall apply a public notice shall be required for any proposed annexation the city shall post a public notice sign on each street frontage of the subject property no later than 20 days prior to the public hearing before the planning commission b an appropriate zoning district for the land areas proposed to be annexed shall be recommended to city council by the planning commission c adjustments shall be made on the zoning map within 60 days after the effective date of any annexation information regarding the annexation shall be made readily available to the public in the interim article 2  residential districts   singlefamily rs15 rs10 rs8 rs6 districts the residential singlefamily districts provide for lowdensity residential neighborhoods by prohibiting multifamily residential commercial industrial and any other incompatible use of land the district designations incorporate the minimum lot size for easy reference for example rs10 has a 10000squarefoot minimum lot size   singlefamilyhorse rsh district the residential singlefamilyhorse rsh district provides for lowdensity residential neighborhoods on lots of at least one acre by prohibiting multifamily residential commercial industrial and any other incompatible use of land while allowing horses and stables that are not used for commercial purposes on singlefamily lots as an accessory use by right this district shall be applied only to areas annexed to the city after    singlefamilystable rss district the residential singlefamilystable rss district provides for lowdensity residential uses on large lots of at least three acres by prohibiting multifamily residential commercial industrial and any other incompatible use of land while allowing for open spaces suitable for horse pleasure stables and for singlefamily residential properties on which horses are kept   singlefamily attached rsa district the residential singlefamily attached rsa district provides for the development of three or more separate dwelling units each on its own lot but having common walls the rsa district is intended primarily for areas near lowintensity commercial zones and may serve as a transition between such uses and areas of detached singlefamily dwellings the rsa district includes mandatory design standards to promote appropriate design and compatibility with surrounding uses    manufactured home rsm district the residential manufactured home rsm district provides for lowdensity residential neighborhoods by prohibiting multifamily residential commercial industrial and any other incompatible use of land while allowing for manufactured housing units   multifamily rml rmh districts the multifamily districts provide for medium to highdensity residential neighborhoods made up of attached singlefamily and multifamily units protected from incompatible land uses   manufactured home park rmp district the manufactured home park rmp district provides a sound and healthy residential environment for manufactured home parks standards and protection from incompatible uses article 3  special purpose districts   planned residential development pr district the planned residential pr district permits greater flexibility and more creative and imaginative design for the development of residential areas than is generally possible in other residential districts while potentially allowing a limited range of nonresidential uses primarily serving the residents of the pr project in exchange for there typically being no minimum lot sizes and widths or minimum setbacks and a variety of housing types the developer gives city council control of the details of a proposed project of a concept plan the district promotes more economical and efficient use of the land a harmonious variety of housing types a higher level of amenities compatibility with surrounding uses preservation of natural features and open space and the interconnection of trails and sidewalks    horse hd district the horse hd district provides for the protection and creation of open spaces and facilities necessary for horsetraining businesses polo and other equestrian activities and prohibits land uses incompatible with such activities   open space os district the open space os district is intended for environmentally sensitive areas and areas of open space and related structures that represent a valuable aesthetic asset including such natural areas as remnant carolina bays and the portions of hitchcock woods within the city limits along with such historic open space areas as rye patch and hopeland gardens article 4  commercial districts   limited professional lp district the limited professional lp district provides locations for blending limitedscale professional offices and selected institutions and service uses with residential uses the floor area and design of such uses is regulated to ensure compatibility with adjacent residential areas the district prohibits retail trade and is primarily intended to serve as a transition between more intense commercial uses and existing residential areas   limited business lb district the limited business lb district provides for blending a limited range of retail and service activities of a pedestrianoriented nature with residential uses the floor area and design of such uses is regulated to ensure compatibility with adjacent residential areas the district is primarily intended to serve as a transition between more intense commercial uses and existing residential areas   officeinstitutional o district the officeinstitutional o district provides locations for a wide range of professional offices institutions selected service uses and where appropriate residential uses primarily intended for location along major roadways the district is also intended for areas dominated by institutions such as a hospital or college   general business gb district the general business gb district allows a broad range of commercial uses offering both retail goods and services and where appropriate residential uses because the district is intended to serve people from throughout the community who use automobiles to reach the uses it is located along major roadways but uses should also be accessible to pedestrians   planned commercial pc district the planned commercial pc district provides for a group of commercial establishments offering a wide range of retail goods and services that are planned and developed as a unit and where appropriate residential uses the district requires adequate traffic controls on public streets sufficient offstreet parking and offstreet loading and protection of adjacent neighborhoods   planned institutional pi district the planned institutional zone provides locations for schools churches and some other institutional uses in locations which may affect residential or other more restrictive zones or less intense uses the district requires a concept plan approved by city council after planning commission review which may address site layout building design tree protection and buffers and other issues to assure compatibility with surrounding uses    downtown business db district the downtown business db district provides for the central commercial and civic functions in the city in a compact area offering maximum convenience although activities are intended to be walkingscale they serve the entire community the integration of retail service entertainment government and residential uses is encouraged article 5  industrial districts   light industrial li district the light industrial li district provides for lowintensity industrial uses warehousing and wholesaling activities that do not overburden the available streets infrastructure or public services   limited manufacturing lm district the limited manufacturing lm district provides low and mediumintensity manufacturing and industrial uses warehousing and wholesaling activities that do not overburden the available streets infrastructure or public services    industrial i district the industrial i district provides for a wide variety of industrial uses warehousing and wholesaling activities that do not overburden the available streets infrastructure or public services article 6  overlay districts   historic preservation h overlay district a it is essential that the qualities areas sites structures and natural and manmade objects relating to the history of the city of aiken as well as that of aiken county the state of south carolina and the united states of america be preserved and that a generally harmonious exterior appearance of areas sites structures and objects that preserves property values and attracts businesses tourists and residents alike be promoted the purpose of the historic preservation h overlay district is to promote the educational cultural economic and general welfare of the public protection of historically architecturally and archeologically valuable areas sites structures objects districts and neighborhoods along with the promotion of a general harmony as to style form proportion and texture between historic structures and those of more modern design b through historic preservation and the encouragement of harmonious outward appearance the historic preservation overlay district and its related review procedures will help ensure the following 1 safeguard the heritage of the city of aiken so that its historic areas sites structures neighborhood districts and objects continue to be a distinctive aspect of the city and a visible reminder of the special historical and cultural heritage of the city  2 preserve the integrity and stability of neighborhoods and business areas  3 conserve and enhance property values of historic areas sites structures districts neighborhoods and geographically associated areas  and 4 promote the continued attraction of businesses residents and tourists thereby strengthening the local economy   old aiken overlay oa district this district is designed to promote a high level of aesthetics and the economic stability of the downtown area by protecting and enhancing the appearance of existing structures and the appearance of new structures the downtown area is the heart of the city and deserves special protection that this district provides chapter 3  use regulations article 1  use tables   types of use all of the use categories listed in the following use tables are uses determined by the building official to constitute a hazard danger or nuisance to the public because of noise odor glare particulate matter traffic impediments or similar reasons including the storage of hazardous materials as defined by the national fire protection association guide or any successor publication thereto officially used by the building official shall not be permitted in any commercial district b other uses not permitted due to the limited industrial character and environmental assets of aiken the following uses are considered noxious and inappropriate and are therefore prohibited within the city limits 1 battery manufacturing or recycling 2 intensive agriculture including hog farming 3 meat packing 4 petroleum refining and storage 5 plastics manufacturing 6 pulp and paper manufacturing 7 rubber manufacturing 8 tanneries   uses permitted in the os district the only principal use permitted by right in the os district is passive recreation accessory uses may be caretakers facilities  amphitheaters and stages  meeting facilities  museums  accessory restaurants and food service areas  botanical gardens  nature study areas  and similar uses   accessory uses classifications use categories classify land uses and activities based on common functional product or physical characteristics characteristics include the type and amount of activity the type of customers or residents how goods or services are sold or delivered likely impact on surrounding properties and site conditions the use categories provide a systematic basis for assigning land uses to appropriate zoning districts b principal use characteristics a principal use is assigned to the use category that most closely corresponds to its nature as described in the characteristics subsection of each use category c considerations regarding principal uses 1 determination of the appropriate category for a proposed principal use shall be made by the planning director in accordance with the provisions of  2 the following shall be used to determine 1 the appropriate category for a use not specifically listed in the use tables or the examples in the use category descriptions and 2 whether a use is considered principal or accessory a the actual or projected characteristics of the activity in relationship to the stated characteristics of each use category b the relative amount of site area or floor space and equipment devoted to the activity c relative amounts of sales from each activity d the customer type for each activity e the relative number of employees in each activity f hours of operation g building and site arrangement h vehicles used and their parking requirements i the relative number of vehicle trips generated j signs k how the use is advertised l the likely impact on surrounding properties m whether the activity is likely to be found independent of the other activities on the site 3 when considering appropriate districts for a use not listed in the use tables the district intent statements in shall be taken into consideration d developments with multiple principal uses developments with multiple principal uses shall conform to the following 1 when all principal uses of a development fall within one use category the entire development is assigned to that use category 2 when the principal uses of a development fall within different use categories each principal use is classified in the applicable use category and each use is subject to all applicable regulations for that use category 3 developments with multiple principal uses such as shopping centers shall incorporate only those uses allowed in the underlying district e accessory uses accessory uses are allowed by right in conjunction with a principal use unless otherwise stated elsewhere in this unless otherwise stated accessory uses are subject to the same regulations as the principal use common accessory uses are listed as examples in the use category descriptions f use of examples the examples subsection of each use category lists uses common to that use category the names of these sample uses are generic and are based on common meanings not on what a specific use may call itself for example a use that calls itself wholesale warehouse but sells mostly to retail consumers is included in the retail sales and service category rather than the wholesale trade category g uses not included the uses not included subsection provides crossreferences to uses that may appear to be part of a particular category but which are explicitly handled in a different use category   residential use categories a household living 1 characteristics residential occupancy of a dwelling unit by a household on a monthtomonth or longer basis 2 examples living in houses duplexes triplexes other multidwelling structures retirement center apartments type 1 group homes group homes that are considered singlefamily residences and other structures with selfcontained dwelling units 3 accessory uses recreational activities raising of pets hobbies swimming pools storage units and offstreet parking of the occupants registered vehicles home occupations including inhome care for under six persons  and accessory apartments  are accessory uses subject to additional regulations 4 uses not included a lodging where unit is rented on a lessthanmonthly basis overnight accommodations b group homes that are not considered singlefamily residences such as type 2 or type 3 group homes group living c nursing or convalescent home or residential assisted living facility not having individual dwelling units group living b group living 1 characteristics residential occupancy of a structure by a group of people that does not meet the definition of household living tenancy is usually arranged on a monthly or longer basis generally group living structures have a common eating area for residents and the residents may receive care training or treatment 2 examples type 2 group homes for the physically disabled mentally retarded or emotionally disturbed  type 3 group homes for drug and alcohol treatment and alternative or postincarceration facilities  nursing or convalescent homes  residential assisted living facilities not having individual dwelling units  orphanages  dormitories fraternities and sororities  monasteries and convents 3 accessory uses recreational facilities associated offices food preparation and dining facilities and offstreet parking of vehicles for occupants and staff 4 uses not included a lodging where tenancy may be arranged for periods architectural controls 1 materials predominant exterior building materials may include brick wood stone tile split concrete block or stucco smoothfaced concrete block are not permitted 2 colors exterior faade colors must be lowreflecting lowintensity subtle and neutral or earthtoned building trim may feature brighter complementary colors that do not overwhelm the primary colors neon tubing is not allowed as an accent material 3 rooflines rooflines shall be varied to add interest minimize massive scale and complement the character of nearby neighborhoods by using parapets gables eaves or other similar designs 4 exterior walls no large expanse of blank exterior wall will be allowed variation may be achieved by using recesses projections windows columns horizontal and vertical offsets awnings canopies and other features 5 screening of rooftop or other mechanical or electrical equipment equipment shall be screened to minimize noise and views from all directions except overhead if equipment  shrubbery must be large enough at the time of planting to screen the equipment 6 location of walkways and entrances the building design shall clearly indicate to visitors where entrances shall comply with the requirements for the planned commercial zone at  9 types heights and location of perimeter fences fences shall not exceed eight feet in height except those for outdoor sales and storage areas chainlink fencing is not permitted d landscaping 1 general a conceptual landscape plan shall be incorporated as part of concept plan approval prior to issuance of a building permit approval of a detailed landscape plan conforming to the landscaping and tree preservation provisions in shall be approved except where such provisions would conflict with the following 2 planting strip along a street rightofway a along any frontage adjacent to a street rightofway including outparcels there shall be a landscaped planting strip at least 30 feet in depth any of this strip subsequently dedicated to the city to be preserved as planting strip shall still be included in meeting the requirements of this section b the maximum number of trees must be planted as determined by the planning director taking into account the size of the trees at maturity the planning director shall approve the type size and location of trees as well as any combination of large and small trees to meet this requirement any area in the planting strip beyond the minimum area required shall not be included in determining the required number of trees c there shall be a continuous screen consisting of either evergreen shrubbery andor a berm with plantings complying with the following i if only shrubbery is used the plantings shall be at least three feet high after pruning at the time of planting and shall be planted no more than five feet on center in at least two staggered rows ii any berm must be at least two feet high any berm less than five feet high must be planted with evergreen shrubbery at least two feet high after pruning at the time of planting and shall be planted no more than five feet on center in at least two staggered rows iii if a berm without shrubbery is used it shall be at least five feet high and be planted with ground cover iv the screen shall be maintained at a minimum of five feet in height after plantings have matured d the planting strip may include a sidewalk or pathway parallel to the street andor sidewalks or pathways perpendicular to the street to provide a pedestrian connection to parking areas 3 screening of garbage and trash collection areas and delivery and loading areas these areas shall be screened from view of adjacent property and street rightsofway with a masonry wall or wooden fence andor evergreen shrubbery shall be located away from pedestrian and vehicular traffic and shall be out of sight to the maximum feasible extent e delivery and loading 1 general delivery and loading areas shall be designed and located to minimize visual and noise impacts to residential areas 2 setbacks and buffers each delivery and loading dock shall be set back at least 75 feet from land zoned or used residentially including a landscaped buffer at least 30 feet in depth along the property line conforming to e 3 trucks delivery trucks shall not be parked during nondelivery hours with any motor compressor refrigerator or similar device running unless it is at least 50 feet from property zoned or used residentially f signage in addition to complying with the sign provisions in all signs within in a new or altered large
